intro: Moraea villosa subsp. elandsmontana, commonly known as the Elandsmontana glory flower, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that typically bloom in summer. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of vivid blue to purple flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
